channel.title: SMF Quick Question
channel.description:
Hey, So now I am starting up my server and basically I just need to know, Is there a way to make a board where when the threads are posted only me or staff members can see them?
Thanks, RS PS

item.title: SMF Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @RS_PS RS PS
item.description:
@RS_PS wrote:

Sorry My Bad, Will try it

Read full topic

item.title: SMF Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“RS PS, post:20, topic:447120”]Sorry what your saying has nothing to with my problem…

This is the problem:

I need a board where when the threads are posted by players only the OP and me can see that thread and post in it.[/quote]
iCreatedHorror actually had the correct answer, look into what he said before discarding the suggestion so quickly…

Read full topic

item.title: SMF Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

[quote=“RS PS, post:20, topic:447120”]Sorry what your saying has nothing to with my problem…

This is the problem:

I need a board where when the threads are posted by players only the OP and me can see that thread and post in it.[/quote]Which is what I said…the posts will only be visible to the OP and staff, unless the post is approved. Leaving it unapproved will keep it hidden.

Read full topic

item.title: SMF Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

[quote=“RS PS, post:18, topic:447120”]asyo4 what your saying is wrong. Please read all the comments I have posted.[/quote]Make a board permission group which requires post approval. In the modify board section, for the permission profile, choose the permission set you made.

Read full topic

item.title: SMF Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @asyo4 asyo4
item.description:
@asyo4 wrote:

Yes - when you’re creating a board, in the dropdown menu select “Read Only”. You’ll see it. And deselect all of the membergroups except Administrator or Gmod which ever one you prefer.

Read full topic

item.title: SMF Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I think Tahorak misunderstood the question but his answer is still correct, works like that for most forums. Just set the permissions for that board to what you want.

Read full topic

item.title: SMF Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Taharok:

If you’re using SMF 2.0, you’ll need to setup a board profile just for that board. In a board profile, you’re able to specify what permissions each group is allowed within that board. Thusly, you can set your staff ranks to be able to post whereas you set all “regular members” to not be able to post, but still grant them access to view the board. This is how the announcements board works here.

I think he’s going more along the lines of the suggestions board and the sponsored server applications.

All you have to do is make it so said users post must be approved by a moderator.

Read full topic

item.title: SMF Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Taharok:

If you’re using SMF 2.0, you’ll need to setup a board profile just for that board. In a board profile, you’re able to specify what permissions each group is allowed within that board. Thusly, you can set your staff ranks to be able to post whereas you set all “regular members” to not be able to post, but still grant them access to view the board. This is how the announcements board works here.

He wants it so only the OP and staff can see the thread, so user1 can only see his threads, while user2 can’t, but user2 can still see his own threads

Read full topic

item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

If you’re using SMF 2.0, you’ll need to setup a board profile just for that board. In a board profile, you’re able to specify what permissions each group is allowed within that board. Thusly, you can set your staff ranks to be able to post whereas you set all “regular members” to not be able to post, but still grant them access to view the board. This is how the announcements board works here.

item.title: SMF Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @RS_PS RS PS
item.description:
@RS_PS wrote:

Whackatre:

Admin -> Boards -> The Board -> Modify -> Allowed Groups

Won’t that stop players from posting in their? I need it so they can post in their but only me and the person who posted can see the thread…

Read full topic
